Class: SweepContext

SweepContext

new SweepContext(contour, options)

Constructor for the triangulation context. It accepts a simple polyline (with non repeating points), which defines the constrained edges.
Parameters:
Name Type Argument Description
contour Array.<XY> array of point objects. The points can be either Point instances, or any "Point like" custom class with {x, y} attributes.
options SweepContextOptions <optional>
 constructor options
Source:
  • sweepcontext.js, line 150
Examples
var contour = [
    new poly2tri.Point(100, 100),
    new poly2tri.Point(100, 300),
    new poly2tri.Point(300, 300),
    new poly2tri.Point(300, 100)
];
var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour, {cloneArrays: true});
var contour = [{x:100, y:100}, {x:100, y:300}, {x:300, y:300}, {x:300, y:100}];
var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour, {cloneArrays: true});

Methods

AddHole()

For backward compatibility
Deprecated:
  • use SweepContext#addHole instead
    Source:
    • sweepcontext.js, line 235

    addHole(polyline)

    Add a hole to the constraints
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    polyline Array.<XY> array of "Point like" objects with {x,y}
    Source:
    • sweepcontext.js, line 221
    Examples
    var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
var hole = [
    new poly2tri.Point(200, 200),
    new poly2tri.Point(200, 250),
    new poly2tri.Point(250, 250)
];
swctx.addHole(hole);
    var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.addHole([{x:200, y:200}, {x:200, y:250}, {x:250, y:250}]);

    addHoles(holes)

    Add several holes to the constraints
    Parameters:
    Name Type Description
    holes Array.<Array.<XY>> array of array of "Point like" objects with {x,y}
    Source:
    • sweepcontext.js, line 258
    Examples
    var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
var holes = [
    [ new poly2tri.Point(200, 200), new poly2tri.Point(200, 250), new poly2tri.Point(250, 250) ],
    [ new poly2tri.Point(300, 300), new poly2tri.Point(300, 350), new poly2tri.Point(350, 350) ]
];
swctx.addHoles(holes);
    var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
var holes = [
    [{x:200, y:200}, {x:200, y:250}, {x:250, y:250}],
    [{x:300, y:300}, {x:300, y:350}, {x:350, y:350}]
];
swctx.addHoles(holes);

    AddPoint()

    For backward compatibility
    Deprecated:
    • use SweepContext#addPoint instead
      Source:
      • sweepcontext.js, line 290

      addPoint(point)

      Add a Steiner point to the constraints
      Parameters:
      Name Type Description
      point XY any "Point like" object with {x,y}
      Source:
      • sweepcontext.js, line 280
      Examples
      var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
var point = new poly2tri.Point(150, 150);
swctx.addPoint(point);
      var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.addPoint({x:150, y:150});

      addPoints(points)

      Add several Steiner points to the constraints
      Parameters:
      Name Type Description
      points Array.<XY> array of "Point like" object with {x,y}
      Source:
      • sweepcontext.js, line 310
      Examples
      var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
var points = [
    new poly2tri.Point(150, 150),
    new poly2tri.Point(200, 250),
    new poly2tri.Point(250, 250)
];
swctx.addPoints(points);
      var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.addPoints([{x:150, y:150}, {x:200, y:250}, {x:250, y:250}]);

      getBoundingBox() → {Object}

      Get the bounding box of the provided constraints (contour, holes and Steinter points). Warning : these values are not available if the triangulation has not been done yet.
      Source:
      • sweepcontext.js, line 341
      Returns:
      object with 'min' and 'max' Point
      Type
      Object

      GetTriangles()

      For backward compatibility
      Deprecated:
      • use SweepContext#getTriangles instead
        Source:
        • sweepcontext.js, line 373

        getTriangles() → {array.<Triangle>}

        Get result of triangulation. The output triangles have vertices which are references to the initial input points (not copies): any custom fields in the initial points can be retrieved in the output triangles.
        Source:
        • sweepcontext.js, line 364
        Returns:
        array of triangles
        Type
        array.<Triangle>
        Examples
        var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.triangulate();
var triangles = swctx.getTriangles();
        var contour = [{x:100, y:100, id:1}, {x:100, y:300, id:2}, {x:300, y:300, id:3}];
var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.triangulate();
var triangles = swctx.getTriangles();
typeof triangles[0].getPoint(0).id
// → "number"

        triangulate()

        Triangulate the polygon with holes and Steiner points. Do this AFTER you've added the polyline, holes, and Steiner points
        Source:
        • sweepcontext.js, line 327
        Example
        var swctx = new poly2tri.SweepContext(contour);
swctx.triangulate();
var triangles = swctx.getTriangles();
